greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime factors of n divided by the number of n's distinct prime factors (rounded).
comment: a(n) is the rounded average of the exponents in the prime factorization of n.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
example: 36 is in A067340. 12 and 60 are in A070011.
xref: Cf. A001221 (omega(n)), A001222 (bigomega(n)), A067340 (ratio is integer before rounding), A070011 (ratio is not an integer), A070012 (floor of ratio), A070014 (ceiling of ratio), A046660 (bigomega(n)-omega(n)).
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_, Apr 11 2002
